author: A_Brickset_user
title: "Igor, I'm thirsty"
review: This set is great. It has a Count Dracula with 2 faces, One with his mouth shut and one with his mouth wide-open. The Igor fig is also great and it has a medievil hat that was a long time not seen in lego sets. The actorfellow is nice but not very special. The tile with the onionthings  (I don't know the english name for Knoflook) on it is great. The background with the coffin is very nice but the paper thing in the background was not necessairy. The crewman is nice.

author: ratz
title: just for the figs!
review: personally i think the whole studios-theme is kind of useless, but provides you with lots of usefull grey and sand-blue parts. and of course you get the really cool hunchback, a dracula figure (for any medieval setting) and a dude with a very handsome suit in tan and a very scared face if you turn his head.

author: mrmitch
title: Great set to Own
review: Cool mini figures that have two different faces a major plus. A coffin for the vampire oh yea, I like the whole theme in this set, its different and can be filmed by the camera man, you can use your imagination and have alot of fun with this set.

author: Smallsam99
title: the only lego vampire
review:
THis set here is a very unique set and sets itself apart from many others. For one it has some unique pieces and has the only released lego vampire. The set has a great playibility that can be put in and a decent amount of figures. It also was a very cheap set to buy. I found this set at a K.B. toys in '03 I think. It wasd only 11 dollars so I bought it. Now lets review it.
pros: 
-rare pieces and colors.

-onions piece (very rare)

-only lego vampire ever!

-coffin

-interchanging faces

COns:none

Overall a pretty solid set and shows off lego's creative side. It also has a sound cd in it for lego studios movie maker. I rate it about a 8.5/10 and say to get it for about 25 dollars or less.

author: legoman4694
title: funny!
review: i love it! count dracula has a cool cape and his face turns around so he looks like he wants blood. theres a coffin too. its cool how the only thing that makes it studios is the guy with the light. no hidden camera no director nothing. just him. also the guys head turns around so he looks scared. so much for a fearless hero! there is some hobo and the piece with the sheld and stuff is cardboard. there is also garlic and a gem. theres too many good things to list so just get it. you wont be sorry!

author: Bricktoothyo
title: DRACULA HAS RISEN FROM THE GRAVE!
review:
This one got me buying Lego again,bigtime.
A Vampire minifig has got to be the coolest thing since the ghost,and the hunchback guy is an absolute classic-you can use his face to make a good (as in bad)witch
The hero is pretty cool,Ive found his outfit very useful too.
As shown on the box,this set has a great adaptability to it,you can rearrange it in a lot of different ways giving it a lot of playability as far as Im concerned,I really like the carriage pictured on it.
Even the comic in the instructions is a real hoot!
With the tree and bowl with WOLF on it(on the other side of the cardboard slip) it ties in really nicely to the Werewolf ambush set and Ive combined them along with a few other things to make a scary castle/haunted forest.
10/10

author: just2good
title: LEGO Garlic
review:
I got this when I was 4. It's a great set, especially the vampire! It also has a cool scene.

Pros+
+ 4 minifigs
+ garlic
+ bats
+ coffin
+ igor?
+ new camera man shirt
+ more to the "creepy" studio subtheme

Cons-
- needs baseplate
- no director

Awesome set! :D

author: UFO_and_Insectoids
title: Beware the Vampires Crypt!
review:
This is my personal favorite Lego Studio set! Another great addition to the Scary Monster line, this set is packed with cool chambers, details, pieces and most cool, the vampire minifigure! Here is the pros and cons

 

  • Pros-
  • Awesome parts and minifigures!
  • Cool rooms/chambers!
  • Vampire minifig!
  • Minifigs heads rotate to reveal different expression!

 

  • Cons-
  • None

Set is awesome and earns a 5/5

author: captain_radda_radda
title: No one can resist the thrill of the THRILLA!!
review:
This is a pretty good set. I stumbled upon it while I was digging through my stuff. It has a lot of rare elements and has 2 exclusive minifigs. 

Pros:
Rare stuff
cool coffin
rare cape
Possible to do the Lego Thriller!

Cons:
nothing to hold the set together
features don't work that well

author: starwarslegosrock
title: Vampire's Crypt
review: I got this set when i was six this was my second lego set i ever got and i love all the cool features like the pop up coffin, the skeleton in the case, and the moving cart. This was one of my  favorite sets ever but i have lot a bunch of pieces which stinks.

author: ledaKat
title: "I Vant to Suck your Blood"
review:
Worth every cent you can spare to get your hands on this Scary Studios theme.  The Monster minifigs are wicked! Totally unique and full of character.

I just recently found all the Scary Studios sets (very exciting because I am a huge fan of the Universal Studios Monster Movies of the 1930s and 1940s) so to combine my two favourite things, Lego and Monster movies, is quite simply wonderful. Vampire's Crypt was the first one to have arrived. So I promtly made it up and couldn't stop grinning the whole time. I love that vampire. He has the most awesome cloak, his hair is gorgeous and he has a double sided face. The second face has blood around his mouth, fiendishly sick. I love it!

The set itself is also really cool, there is a neat little backdrop of the dungeon wall which is also double sided. The back is the view from the outside, and has a window and a dog bowl on the groung.  It is a nice size, compact and in three sections so you can move it and arrange it however you wish.  It has a neat construction design, the Vampire's coffin can slide across the top of the set towards the platform, the platform is lowered down level to the cart, turn the knob and the coffin slides effortlessly onto the cart.

I give this set an easy 5 bricks, and the Vampire fig gets a 6 brick rating.

author: MIDAS
title: A good studios set
review:
This was one of the first bigger lego sets i got. I was very young, and didn't really get the full hang of lego at the time. But i remember the set well, and i still have most of the pieces and minifigs intact, though i can't seem to find the hunchback's head, or hood.
The building, for me, at the time, was a bit confusing. The use of rubber bands i thought was a bit badly shown in the instructions, and it's an aspect of the set i didn't really ever make use of. The idea at the end of the instructions confused me then, i thought it was more to the set, so i tried to build it etc. Suffice it to say, i may not have got the full benefit of the set. But anyway- Pros and Cons.
  • Pros
  • Set looks good
  • Great minifigs - dracula is particularly well done
  • Enjoyable build mostly, some complex areas
  • Good blend between film and actual fantasy
  • Rare pieces, including an exclusive coffin - i think.
  • Cons
  • Doesn't integrate well with some cities,
  • Somewhat confusing instructions.

author: Fire
title: Vampire attack!
review:
I got this set when it first came out, and it was one of the starter sets for what is now my expanded Haunted Village (which has basically become a medieval village with the haunted portion at the center).

 

The vampire, I believe the first of its kind, is great, as is the hunchback guy.  The layout is pretty cool, and it's got a lot of nice features and pieces that make it a great set for any Halloween or Castle fan.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Studios - Vampire's Crypt Review
review:
I love this set. It's also the first set which has a vampire minifig. This vampire looks much better than the one from the collectable minifigures series 2. I like his cape and the face of that minifig. He has a black suit and black hair. This is a nice scary looking vampire. The other minifigs are a gent who looks a little bit likes James Bond, an old man with a brown hood and an assistant.

The set itself is awsome. We get a nice double-printed background for this scene and two towers. The first tower has a stairway which leads you to the top of that building. On the top you can put the brown sarcophagus where you can put the vampire in. On the bottom of this tower is a gem and a piece which has some garlic on it. I think it's the only way to get ths piece. The other tower just has a lift which you can use to put the sarcophagus to the other tower. It's a fun build and we also don't get any stickers to worry about.

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Stopmotion 3
Review

author: LegoMunchy88
title: The Best Studios Set
review:
Lego Vampire Crypt is the best set of the Studios theme in my opinion, but that really isn't saying much. Although, this really is a great set. With decent parts and great minifigures, this is overall very nice.

 

The Minifigs

Vampire: Obviously the best minifigure of the set, with a nice reversable head, and that coffin is awesome.

Gent: Gent is the official Lego name for the guy in the tan. He's a nice unsuspecting victim, though I'm not sure why he's always the victim, as in Mummy's Tomb, Werewolf Ambush, and Scary Laboratory.

Vampire's Servant: I find it amusing to refer to this guy as "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" or "Quasimoto". A nice figure, nothing really special though.

Director/Filmer: The figure is alright, but he adds a whole new playability to the set. Now, the "film" can be cut, started over, and premiered in sets like the Town Plan's movie theater.

 

The Set

The set is really three main section with a cart as well. I'll talk about the cart first: it's a cart. There's really nothing else to say. It's a cart that can carry Dracula and his coffin around, but that's it. Next I'll talk about the first section. The first section includes a skeleton head in a glass case, which is very difficult to attach again after taking it off, and some garlic. The reason for the garlic is obviously because Vampires are apparently scared off by garlic for some reason. Hidden behind the garlic is a jewel, which I like to stick in the coffin. The second section is just a piece of carboard with two inverted pictures on it. The first is the inside, with a shelf with books and some candles. The outside shows a window and a dog bowl. I'm not sure if this was put as a cardboard piece because it's supposed to be like a theater, or just because. Personally, I would have much better liked it built. The final section holds the Vampire's Coffin. With the use of some technic bricks, the coffin falls off the stand and raises up. It's a nice addition to the set, and the coffin is a great piece. The only thing is that I would have loved for those gold things to be part of the actualy piece instead of stickers.

 

Overall

Overall, Lego Vampire Crypt is a nice set, for the right price. With a nice playability factor and some fairly nice parts.

 

Thanks,

LegoMunchy88
